title: What are the observations and theories on hypnotism and suggestion in medicine and education?
first_phrase: This text discusses the phenomenon of hypnotism and its various stages and effects on individuals. It goes on to refute some common misconceptions about hypnotism and highlights the importance of recognizing its legitimacy as a part of scientific study. The text also mentions prominent figures in the field, such as the physician Dr. Philips, and significant events like the scientific congress in Nancy. The last 200 tokens specifically delve into the various suggestions that can be made to subjects during hypnosis, and how they can persist even after the subject has awakened. It also describes how some subjects may try to simulate hypnosis for personal gain, but how a skilled practitioner can easily identify such attempts.
content: Le célèbre docteur D"*, medccin en chef d un grand hôpital de Paris, avait écrit, sur des phénomènes extraordinaires présentés par une hystérique pendant une période de six mors, un rapport circonstancié qui devait être lu à l'Académie de médecine et émerveiller le monde savant. Quelques jours avant la lecture (heureusement), un interne découvrit, par le plus grand des hasards, que l'hystérique, en question n'avait jamais été hypnotisée et qu'elle avait joué six mois la comédie pour avoir à discrétion du poulet, des côtelettes et du vin de Bordeaux. Le docteur D"* dut jeter au feu son rapport.
last_phrase: In conclusion, this anecdote illustrates the importance of confirming and verifying information before drawing conclusions and presenting findings. It also highlights the potential for individuals to manipulate or deceive even the most respected professionals. As researchers and practitioners, it is our responsibility to approach our work with skepticism and rigor, and to remain vigilant for the possibility of fraud or deception.
